column4: hi! just installed Ubuntu (long time debian user) - is it possible to run 2.4 kernel on Ubuntu? (need it for 2.4 kernel modules that doesn't exists in 2.6). One problem - 2.4 doesn't support UFS, other - init gots killed (kernel too old). maybe there is some howto for this? I googled whole day, didn't found anything useful. Any ideas or maybe someone has practical experience?
yes, I know. I dont need to run 2.4 all the time. I just need sometimes to boot 2.4 to make some tests for hour-two (it's ok if system wouldn't be 100% perfectly work) and then reboot to 2.6
